HSM as a Service (HSMaaS), Hardware security modules (HSMs) are fortified, tamper-resistant hardware components that produce, safeguard, and manage keys for encrypting and decrypting data and establishing digital signatures and certificates.

Selected Answer: C
C for sure

Selected Answer: C
C. HSMaaS (Hardware Security Module as a Service): HSMaaS is a cloud service that offers dedicated cryptographic processing and key management. It's designed to protect sensitive data and allows for centralized management and storage of encryption keys. By using HSMaaS, organizations can achieve the required key management across multicloud environments while maintaining centralized control.

Which of the following would best meet the architect's objectives?

questions.question_text: Which of the following best represents an application that does not have an on-premises requirement and is accessible from anywhere?

During an investigation, events from two affected servers in the same subnetwork occurred at the same time:

Server 1: 192.168.10.1 [01/Apr/2021:06:00:00 PST] SAN access denied for user 'admin'
Server 2: 192.168.10.6 [01/Apr/2021:06:01:01 CST] SAN access successful for user 'admin'

Which of the following should be consistently configured to prevent the issue seen in the logs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. NTP (Network Time Protocol)

NTP is used to synchronize the time across devices on a network. Inconsistent time settings between servers can lead to confusion during investigations and issues with event correlation. Configuring NTP ensures that all devices in the network maintain accurate and synchronized time, which is essential for proper log management, security analysis, and event coordination. (synchronized is the word here)

Selected Answer: C
Network Time Protocol. Servers have different time zone

Selected Answer: C
C. NTP (Network Time Protocol)

Selected Answer: C
It's C, not the different time zones.

Would you not ensure the scan engine is running correctly before documenting as a false positive??

Selected Answer: D
will go with D. Although A is one of next steps to check, D is the very next step that we need to document to avoid confusion.

Selected Answer: D
i was thinking about A but since the indication was a false positive and there is no need to reconfigure or make sure the settings. If it ain't broke don't fix it ! right? so going with D.

Selected Answer: D
False Positive: This is a result that indicates a given condition has been fulfilled when it actually has not been fulfilled. In this case, the vulnerability scan flagged a critical vulnerability on the domain controller, but the administrator discovered that the domain controller does not run the associated application with the vulnerability. This indicates that the vulnerability alert is likely a false positive.

Selected Answer: D
document this as a false positive

Selected Answer: C
By researching the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) entry for the flagged vulnerability, the administrator can gain more insight into the nature of the vulnerability, affected software/applications, and conditions under which the vulnerability would be applicable. This would help in confirming whether the vulnerability is indeed not applicable to the domain controller and whether it's a false positive.

Selected Answer: D
First of all, document this as a false positive.

Selected Answer: D
the most immediate action is to document the finding as a false positive (Option D), but further steps should also be considered to ensure the security and accuracy of the environment

Selected Answer: D
Document first then fine tune the scanner.

questions.question_text: The most recent vulnerability scan flagged the domain controller with a critical vulnerability. The systems administrator researched the vulnerability and discovered the domain controller does not run the associated application with the vulnerability. Which of the following steps should the administrator take next?

choices.A: Ensure the scan engine is configured correctly.
choices.B: Apply a patch to the domain controller.
choices.D: Document this as a false positive.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The demand asked regard to CASB.

Selected Answer: B
When it's cloud choose CASB

Selected Answer: B
CASB: This is a security policy enforcement point that provides visibility into cloud application use across cloud platforms and identifies unauthorized apps. It can enforce security policies, prevent unwanted activity, and manage how data is moved into the cloud. It can also restrict the download of company applications for personal use and control the data that is uploaded.

Selected Answer: D
I think the answer is D. NG-SWG (is Cloud-based)
Based on the below link, it has inline CASB, DLP features too.
https://www.netskope.com/security-defined/next-gen-secure-web-gateway

Selected Answer: B
A Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) would best meet the requirements stated in the scenario. CASBs can provide visibility into which cloud applications are being used across a company, restrict data that is uploaded to the cloud, and prevent unauthorized downloading of company applications for personal use. They act as a gatekeeper, allowing the organization to extend its security policies beyond its own infrastructure. CASBs provide features like visibility, data security, threat protection, and compliance, ensuring secure and only authorized use of cloud services by employees.

Selected Answer: B
B. A CASB (Cloud Access Security Broker): A CASB gives visibility into cloud application usage across the company. It also provides granular control over data movement in and out of cloud applications, thus preventing unauthorized data uploads and restricting certain features like downloading apps for personal use. It's designed specifically for cloud environments

Selected Answer: B
Chatgpt:
The solution that best meets the requirements of preventing users from downloading company applications for personal use, restricting data uploads, and providing visibility into application usage across the company is B. A CASB (Cloud Access Security Broker).

A CASB is specifically designed to address cloud security concerns and can help enforce policies related to application usage, data protection, and visibility into cloud services.

questions.question_text: A company has decided to move its operations to the cloud. It wants to utilize technology that will prevent users from downloading company applications for personal use, restrict data that is uploaded, and have visibility into which applications are being used across the company. Which of the following solutions will best meet these requirements?
